Continental Customer AdvisoryPST IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE DEAR MR GIRON Continental Ai rlines is committed to meeting new federal requirements regarding checked b aggage and airport security fees In an effort to keep you informed below are the most recent changes that will affect your travel POSITIVE BAG MA TCH Effective January the Federal Aviation Administration will req uire a positive bag match for travel within the US its territories and c ommonwealths Bags cannot be transported on the aircraft without confirmat ion that the customer has boarded the aircraft DOMESTIC CHECKINARRIVAL TIME To ensure compliance with the Positive Bag Match policy without delay s or inconvenience Continental Airlines has changed the boarding time for domestic flights for tickets purchased on or after January Custo mers checking baggage must do so at least minutes prior to departure A ll customers must be checked in and at the boarding gate no later than m inutes prior to scheduled departure Customers who buy tickets on or aft er January who are not at the boarding gate minutes prior to de parture are subject to having their reservations canceled seats released a nd checked baggage removed from the flight SECURITY FEE The Transportati on Security Administration is requiring that airlines collect the September th Security Fee of per enplanement not to exceed each way o r per roundtrip ticket This security fee goes into effect for tic kets purchased on or after February It applies to qualifying enpl anements from airports in the US its territories and commonwealths Thi s fee applies to all tickets including frequent flyer reward tickets twof orone tickets tour conductors and infants for whom a fare has been collec ted Continental Airlines continues to make safety our number one priority Be sure to stay informed with continentalcom before leaving for the ai rport Were looking forward to welcoming you onboard Sincerely Mark F Bergsrud Vice President Marketing Continental Airlines Inc If you ne ed assistance please visit wwwcontinentalcomservice View our Privacy Policy This message was sent to OnePass Number ES IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE IMAGE

Continental Customer AdvisoryPST DEAR MR GRIFFITH Continental Airlines is committed to meeting new federal requirements regarding checked baggage and airport security fees In an effort to keep you informed below are the most recent changes that will affect your travel POSITIVE BAG MATCH Effective January the Federal Aviation Administration will require a positive bag match for travel within the US its territories and commonwealths Bags cannot be transported on the aircraft without confirmation that the customer has boarded the aircraft DOMESTIC CHECKINARRIVAL TIME To ensure compliance with the Positive Bag Match policy without delays or inconvenience Continental Airlines has changed the boarding time for domestic flights for tickets purchased on or after January Customers checking baggage must do so at least minutes prior to departure All customers must be checked in and at the boarding gate no later than minutes prior to scheduled departure Customers who buy tickets on or after January who are not at the boarding gate minutes prior to departure are subject to having their reservations canceled seats released and checked baggage removed from the flight SECURITY FEE The Transportation Security Administration is requiring that airlines collect the September th Security Fee of per enplanement not to exceed each way or per roundtrip ticket This security fee goes into effect for tickets purchased on or after February It applies to qualifying enplanements from airports in the US its territories and commonwealths This fee applies to all tickets including frequent flyer reward tickets twoforone tickets tour conductors and infants for whom a fare has been collected Continental Airlines continues to make safety our number one priority Be sure to stay informed with continentalcom at servletccJHEVCVqhogEnkpMMpmoQLgkhgEJhtzUA before leaving for the airport Were looking forward to welcoming you onboard Sincerely Mark F Bergsrud Vice President Marketing Continental Airlines Inc If you need assistance please visit servletccJHEVCVqhogEnkpMMpmoQLgkhgEJhtzVA View our Privacy Policy at servletccJHEVCVqhogEnkpMMpmoQLgkhgEJhtzWA This message was sent to OnePass Number FE To modify your OnePass email preferences please login to Your Account at servletccJHEVCVqhogEnkpMMpmoQLgkhgEJhtzXA To unsubscribe from OnePass email please visit servletccJHEVCVqhogEnkpMMpmoQLgkhgEJhtzYA

Continental Customer AdvisoryPST Dear You Love Continental Airlines is committed to meeting new federal requirements regarding checked baggage and airport security fees In an effort to keep you informed below are the most recent changes that will affect your travel POSITIVE BAG MATCH Effective January the Federal Aviation Administration will require a positive bag match for travel within the US its territories and commonwealths Bags cannot be transported on the aircraft without confirmation that the customer has boarded the aircraft DOMESTIC CHECKINARRIVAL TIME To ensure compliance with the Positive Bag Match policy without delays or inconvenience Continental Airlines has changed the boarding time for domestic flights for tickets purchased on or after January Customers checking baggage must do so at least minutes prior to departure All customers must be checked in and at the boarding gate no later than minutes prior to scheduled departure Customers who buy tickets on or after January who are not at the boarding gate minutes prior to departure are subject to having their reservations canceled seats released and checked baggage removed from the flight SECURITY FEE The Transportation Security Administration is requiring that airlines collect the September th Security Fee of per enplanement not to exceed each way or per roundtrip ticket This security fee goes into effect for tickets purchased on or after February It applies to qualifying enplanements from airports in the US its territories and commonwealths This fee applies to all tickets including frequent flyer reward tickets twoforone tickets tour conductors and infants for whom a fare has been collected Continental Airlines continues to make safety our number one priority Be sure to stay informed with continentalcom at servletccJHEVCUishOLQLJmELgkhgEJhtzUA before leaving for the airport Were looking forward to welcoming you onboard Sincerely Mark F Bergsrud Vice President Marketing Continental Airlines Inc If you need assistance please visit servletccJHEVCUishOLQLJmELgkhgEJhtzVA View our Privacy Policy at servletccJHEVCUishOLQLJmELgkhgEJhtzWA This message was sent to To subscribe visit servletccJHEVCUishOLQLJmELgkhgEJhtzXA To unsubscribe visit servletccJHEVCUishOLQLJmELgkhgEJhtzYA

Continental Customer AdvisoryDear Ms Scott Continental Airlines is committed to meeting new federal requirements regarding checked baggage and airport security fees In an effort to keep you informed below are the most recent changes that will affect your travel POSITIVE BAG MATCH Effective January the Federal Aviation Administration will require a positive bag match for travel within the US its territories and commonwealths Bags cannot be transported on the aircraft without confirmation that the customer has boarded the aircraft DOMESTIC CHECKINARRIVAL TIME To ensure compliance with the Positive Bag Match policy without delays or inconvenience Continental Airlines has changed the boarding time for domestic flights for tickets purchased on or after January Customers checking baggage must do so at least minutes prior to departure All customers must be checked in and at the boarding gate no later than minutes prior to scheduled departure Customers who buy tickets on or after January who are not at the boarding gate minutes prior to departure are subject to having their reservations canceled seats released and checked baggage removed from the flight SECURITY FEE The Transportation Security Administration is requiring that airlines collect the September th Security Fee of per enplanement not to exceed each way or per roundtrip ticket This security fee goes into effect for tickets purchased on or after February It applies to qualifying enplanements from airports in the US its territories and commonwealths This fee applies to all tickets including frequent flyer reward tickets twoforone tickets tour conductors and infants for whom a fare has been collected Continental Airlines continues to make safety our number one priority Be sure to stay informed with continentalcom at servletccJHEVCUllJhmmZQLgkhgEJhtzUA before leaving for the airport Were looking forward to welcoming you onboard Sincerely Mark F Bergsrud Vice President Marketing Continental Airlines Inc If you need assistance please visit servletccJHEVCUllJhmmZQLgkhgEJhtzVA View our Privacy Policy at servletccJHEVCUllJhmmZQLgkhgEJhtzWA This message was sent to To subscribe visit servletccJHEVCUllJhmmZQLgkhgEJhtzXA To unsubscribe visit servletccJHEVCUllJhmmZQLgkhgEJhtzYA

Continental Customer AdvisoryPST Dear You Bean Continental Airlines is committed to meeting new federal requirements regarding checked baggage and airport security fees In an effort to keep you informed below are the most recent changes that will affect your travel POSITIVE BAG MATCH Effective January the Federal Aviation Administration will require a positive bag match for travel within the US its territories and commonwealths Bags cannot be transported on the aircraft without confirmation that the customer has boarded the aircraft DOMESTIC CHECKINARRIVAL TIME To ensure compliance with the Positive Bag Match policy without delays or inconvenience Continental Airlines has changed the boarding time for domestic flights for tickets purchased on or after January Customers checking baggage must do so at least minutes prior to departure All customers must be checked in and at the boarding gate no later than minutes prior to scheduled departure Customers who buy tickets on or after January who are not at the boarding gate minutes prior to departure are subject to having their reservations canceled seats released and checked baggage removed from the flight SECURITY FEE The Transportation Security Administration is requiring that airlines collect the September th Security Fee of per enplanement not to exceed each way or per roundtrip ticket This security fee goes into effect for tickets purchased on or after February It applies to qualifying enplanements from airports in the US its territories and commonwealths This fee applies to all tickets including frequent flyer reward tickets twoforone tickets tour conductors and infants for whom a fare has been collected Continental Airlines continues to make safety our number one priority Be sure to stay informed with continentalcom at servletccJHEVCUnlmhkLSQLJmELgkhgEJhtzUA before leaving for the airport Were looking forward to welcoming you onboard Sincerely Mark F Bergsrud Vice President Marketing Continental Airlines Inc If you need assistance please visit servletccJHEVCUnlmhkLSQLJmELgkhgEJhtzVA View our Privacy Policy at servletccJHEVCUnlmhkLSQLJmELgkhgEJhtzWA This message was sent to To subscribe visit servletccJHEVCUnlmhkLSQLJmELgkhgEJhtzXA To unsubscribe visit servletccJHEVCUnlmhkLSQLJmELgkhgEJhtzYA

Continental Customer AdvisoryDear You watson Continental Airlines is committed to meeting new federal requirements regarding checked baggage and airport security fees In an effort to keep you informed below are the most recent changes that will affect your travel POSITIVE BAG MATCH Effective January the Federal Aviation Administration will require a positive bag match for travel within the US its territories and commonwealths Bags cannot be transported on the aircraft without confirmation that the customer has boarded the aircraft DOMESTIC CHECKINARRIVAL TIME To ensure compliance with the Positive Bag Match policy without delays or inconvenience Continental Airlines has changed the boarding time for domestic flights for tickets purchased on or after January Customers checking baggage must do so at least minutes prior to departure All customers must be checked in and at the boarding gate no later than minutes prior to scheduled departure Customers who buy tickets on or after January who are not at the boarding gate minutes prior to departure are subject to having their reservations canceled seats released and checked baggage removed from the flight SECURITY FEE The Transportation Security Administration is requiring that airlines collect the September th Security Fee of per enplanement not to exceed each way or per roundtrip ticket This security fee goes into effect for tickets purchased on or after February It applies to qualifying enplanements from airports in the US its territories and commonwealths This fee applies to all tickets including frequent flyer reward tickets twoforone tickets tour conductors and infants for whom a fare has been collected Continental Airlines continues to make safety our number one priority Be sure to stay informed with continentalcom at servletccJHEVCUrPHmlhgQLgkhgEJhtzUA before leaving for the airport Were looking forward to welcoming you onboard Sincerely Mark F Bergsrud Vice President Marketing Continental Airlines Inc If you need assistance please visit servletccJHEVCUrPHmlhgQLgkhgEJhtzVA View our Privacy Policy at servletccJHEVCUrPHmlhgQLgkhgEJhtzWA This message was sent to To subscribe visit servletccJHEVCUrPHmlhgQLgkhgEJhtzXA To unsubscribe visit servletccJHEVCUrPHmlhgQLgkhgEJhtzYA

Continental Customer AdvisoryDear You Corman Continental Airlines is committed to meeting new federal requirements regarding checked baggage and airport security fees In an effort to keep you informed below are the most recent changes that will affect your travel POSITIVE BAG MATCH Effective January the Federal Aviation Administration will require a positive bag match for travel within the US its territories and commonwealths Bags cannot be transported on the aircraft without confirmation that the customer has boarded the aircraft DOMESTIC CHECKINARRIVAL TIME To ensure compliance with the Positive Bag Match policy without delays or inconvenience Continental Airlines has changed the boarding time for domestic flights for tickets purchased on or after January Customers checking baggage must do so at least minutes prior to departure All customers must be checked in and at the boarding gate no later than minutes prior to scheduled departure Customers who buy tickets on or after January who are not at the boarding gate minutes prior to departure are subject to having their reservations canceled seats released and checked baggage removed from the flight SECURITY FEE The Transportation Security Administration is requiring that airlines collect the September th Security Fee of per enplanement not to exceed each way or per roundtrip ticket This security fee goes into effect for tickets purchased on or after February It applies to qualifying enplanements from airports in the US its territories and commonwealths This fee applies to all tickets including frequent flyer reward tickets twoforone tickets tour conductors and infants for whom a fare has been collected Continental Airlines continues to make safety our number one priority Be sure to stay informed with continentalcom at servletccJHEVCUlJhktHgQLgkhgEJhtzUA before leaving for the airport Were looking forward to welcoming you onboard Sincerely Mark F Bergsrud Vice President Marketing Continental Airlines Inc If you need assistance please visit servletccJHEVCUlJhktHgQLgkhgEJhtzVA View our Privacy Policy at servletccJHEVCUlJhktHgQLgkhgEJhtzWA This message was sent to To subscribe visit
